snippet: The data protection commissioner in Hamburg, Johannes Caspar, said the company was illegally compiling a photo database of users without their consent.
abstract: German data protection offices reopen an investigation into Facebook's facial recognition technology, saying the company is illegally compiling a photo database of users without their consent.
lead_paragraph: The data protection commissioner in Hamburg, Johannes Caspar, said the company was illegally compiling a photo database of users without their consent.

headline.seo: Germany Reopens Investigation of Facebook’s Photo Archiving
headline.main: Germans Reopen Investigation on Facebook Privacy
headline.print_headline: Germany Reopens Privacy Inquiry Into Facebook’s Archiving of User Photos
